text.section:
The Secretary may:
invest in a specialized small business investment company created in accordance with the federal Small Business Investment Act of 1958; and
to the extent allowed by federal law, do anything necessary or convenient to fully participate in the formation and operation of a specialized small business investment company.

Notwithstanding any other law, the Secretary may use money to finance a specialized small business investment company from accounts within:
the Enterprise Fund established under Subtitle 6 of this title; and
the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority established under Subtitle 5 of this title.
